p: Among the predators used in the functional response experiments, each M. albidus copepod was randomly paired with an M. viridis copepod (80 pairs). Predation efficiency predators were also randomly paired, yielding 23 pairs of the two species. For each pair, the M. albidus body mass was subtracted from that of M. viridis, generating 103 differences in body mass due to species. A Wilcoxon rank sum test was used to determine if the body mass differences between copepod species varied by experimental design.
